sentences.en: 'shall I tell my people to pretend they're against the wage - cut, then? "
sentences.cn: “ 我告诉我的人也反对工钱打八折? ”

sentences.en: After the adverts, the presenter tried to pretend that everything was back to normal.
sentences.cn: 广告过后，主持人努力假装一切恢复正常。

sentences.en: Don't pretend to know [ understand ] when you don't.
He does not pretend to be a genius.
He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.cn: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.en: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.cn: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

sentences.en: I had no option but to pretend ignorance.
sentences.cn: 我别无他法，只能假装不知道。

sentences.en: I pretend that things are really okay when they're not.
sentences.cn: 当情况不好的时候我假装一切顺利。

sentences.en: I'm tired of having to pretend all the time.
If you hide away your problems and pretend that they don't exist they will just continue to mount up.
sentences.cn: 如果你把问题藏起来，假装它们不存在，问题只会越积越多。

sentences.en: If you pretend to know what you don't know , you'll only make a fool of yourself.
It would be idle to pretend the system is perfect.
sentences.cn: 假装系统完美无疵是徒劳的。

sentences.en: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.cn: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.en: Let's pretend we're sailing down the Rhine River on a boat.
sentences.cn: 让我们假想我们坐着一艘小船沿着莱茵河而下.

sentences.en: Many people pretend that they understand modern art.
sentences.cn: 许多人装着自己懂得现代艺术.

sentences.en: So you don't need to pretend, do you?
sentences.cn: 所以你不必装假了, 对 吧 ?

sentences.en: The children pretend to be different animals dancing to the music.
sentences.cn: 孩子们扮成不同的动物，随着音乐起舞。

sentences.en: There are not many persons who pretend to exact knowledge of the subject.
sentences.cn: 自认对题目有确切了解的人不多.

sentences.en: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.cn: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

words.tran_cn: 冒牌者；妄求者；妄提要求者
借口；虚假；炫耀；自吹（等于pretence）
假装（pretend的过去式和过去分词）；装扮

trans.tran_en: imaginary or not real - used especially by children
to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
